questions.question: What is the comfyui-previewlatent plugin used for?
questions.answer: The comfyui-previewlatent plugin is a ComfyUI plugin designed for previewing latents without VA(C) decoding. It is useful for showing intermediate results and can serve as a faster preview image alternative when you don't want to use VA(C) decoding.
questions.subject: comfyui-previewlatent

questions.question: How can comfyui-previewlatent be used as a final output for quick testing?
questions.answer: comfyui-previewlatent can be used as a final output for quick testing due to its functionality in previewing latents without VA(C) decoding.
questions.subject: comfyui-previewlatent

questions.question: What kind of previews are generated by comfyui-previewlatent?
questions.answer: comfyui-previewlatent decodes previews using taesd if available, otherwise it uses latent2rgb. These previews are full resolution and not limited to 512x512 like Ksampler previews.
questions.subject: comfyui-previewlatent

questions.question: What is the file format for the previews generated by comfyui-previewlatent?
questions.answer: The previews generated by comfyui-previewlatent are temporary PNG files. They contain full workflow metadata, just like 'Preview Image', so you can right-click and use 'Save Image' to save your workflow.
questions.subject: comfyui-previewlatent

questions.question: What resolution do the previews from comfyui-previewlatent have in comparison to Ksampler previews?
questions.answer: comfyui-previewlatent provides full resolution previews, whereas Ksampler previews are limited to 512x512 resolution.
questions.subject: comfyui-previewlatent
